We are given this one moment in time to do what’s best for Alaska. Let’s take advantage of it. God bless you and God bless the Great State of Alaska. #akleg #akgov
We can achieve so much by working together that the state of our State will be even stronger in the years to come. #akleg #akgov

We must also focus on ensuring our students can read by third grade. Last week, alongside many of you, I introduced the Alaska Reads Act: a bi-partisan approach to reading that focuses resources on evidence-based solutions. #akleg #akgov

As an educator, as a student, I’ve experienced firsthand what a great education can do to transform one’s life. The cornerstone of a great educational program starts with a great teacher. My administration will develop a plan to improve teacher recruitment and retention. #akleg
As we conclude tonight, I want to talk about our greatest resource: our children. Every decision we make this year should be made with our children and grandchildren in mind. #akleg #akgov

The good news: the city of Kodiak is already there. They operate on nearly 100% renewable energy year-round. This is proof that renewables can work. It’s not just good for the environment, it’s good for Alaskans -- it’s really the smart thing to do. #akleg #akgov

Whether it’s tidal, hydro, solar, biomass, wind, or geothermal, we have more potential to deploy renewable energy than anywhere else on the planet, and we have an obligation to make every possible effort to reach this 50% goal by 2025. #akleg #akgov
In 2010, a law was passed by the legislature mandating Alaska produce 50% of its electricity from renewable sources by the year 2025. We are running out of time. #akleg #akgov
Most Alaskan communities are still dependent on expensive diesel and natural gas for electrical generation. We must have inexpensive energy for our future economy. #akleg #akgov

One initiative will allow individuals to exchange their PFD for a land certificate to leverage the purchase of land. These certificates will be issued at twice the value of the historic statutory calculation of the PFD. #akleg #akgov
We are going to put in place a number of initiatives that will enable Alaskans to own a piece of the Last Frontier; easier and cheaper than ever before. #akleg #akgov
One resource Alaska has in abundance is its land. Unfortunately, only 1% of that land is held privately by individuals. No other state has less land in private hands than Alaska. #akleg #akgov

Our compassion must also extend to our homeless population. Too many Alaskans often suffering from addiction and mental health issues find themselves on the streets. Last year, I included over $43 million in funding for programs to address homelessness. #akleg #akgov

Recidivism must be addressed. It’s a fact that over 95% of offenders may one day be our neighbors again. We must work together to reduce and prevent future crime. For those offenders who truly want a second chance, it’s imperative upon us to provide it. #akleg #akgov

My administration will continue to protect Alaska’s most vulnerable by introducing legislation to combat sex trafficking. Individuals engaged in this awful practice will face longer stays in prison. #akleg #akgov
On Alaska Hire, I’m proposing an incentive for contractors that do business with the state to hire as many Alaskans as possible. #akleg #akgov
I will also be proposing legislation creating an Alaska Inspector General to promote accountability and efficiency by investigating waste and fraud. #akleg #akgov
I’ll soon be introducing legislation to create a statewide lottery. Forty-five states have lotteries in place. #akleg #akgov
We must include the people in these decisions.  They must be allowed to vote on a spending cap, any proposed PFD changes, and any new broad-based taxes. #akleg #akgov

Solutions need to be taken up this year. That’s why this year I introduced a flat budget, which should allow us to focus on a sustainable long term plan, including controlling our spending and deciding the future of the permanent fund and the PFD. #akleg #akgov

Last year’s budget was not crafted with the intent to hurt Alaskans. But pulling back the reins on spending certainly caused many Alaskans discomfort -- I recognize that. I didn’t run for governor to hurt the state that I love and the people I care about.  #akleg #akgov

As you know, last year’s budget contained significant reductions. This came in response to the plummeting price of oil, which lost one-third of its value upon taking office. Together, we took a solid first step by reducing spending. #akleg #akgov
Over this last year, it has become clear that @realDonaldTrump has done more for Alaska than any other president in recent history. #akleg #akgov

Outsiders love to present a false choice between resource development and the environment. From their perspective, it’s a win-lose, but from our perspective, it should be a win-win. No one cares more about protecting Alaska than Alaskans.  #akgov #akleg
One-seventh of our nation’s timber is located in Alaska. My administration is advancing a proposal to finally allow our timber industry to compete globally. #akgov #akleg
While I believe oil will continue to play a key role in our future, we must look beyond this industry to diversify our economy and grow our great state. #akleg #akgov
We now have the lowest unemployment rate in the state’s history and wages are at a 10-year high. Our state’s GDP has grown every quarter since I took office. #akgov #akleg
Second, we worked together to grow Alaska’s economy, and the longest recession in Alaska’s history is now over. #akleg #akgov
We eliminated dangerous policies in Alaska’s prisons, increased funding for prosecutors and public defenders, and are addressing a decades-old backlog of untested sexual assault kits. #akleg #akgov
First, we addressed the crime wave that held our communities hostage by enacting comprehensive criminal justice reform. #akleg #akgov
As we begin 2020, I’m proud to report that the state of our state is STRONG. #akgov #akleg

Last summer, we suffered through one of the worst fire seasons in the state’s history, and we’re thankful for the brave firefighters who protected life and property. Together, they fought 742 fires that burned 2.6 million acres of land -- all without a single loss of life. #akleg

Tonight, you’ll hear about initiatives important to all of us, such as putting Alaska’s lands in Alaskan’s hands, preparing kids to succeed, innovative new approaches to revenue, and addressing our fiscal future.  #akgov #akleg
I’m here tonight to talk about my vision for our great state and to share with Alaskans the progress we’ve made together over the past year. #akleg #akgov
